intro: Gnaphalium afghanicum, commonly known as Afghan everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Afghanistan and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, showy composite flowers. The plant produces numerous tiny florets arranged in a cylindrical inflorescence, giving it a fluffy appearance. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and mountainous regions. Gnaphalium afghanicum is also noted for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine.
